babble.net

Class NioClient<R extends Request,P extends Response>

  • java.lang.Object
    • babble.net.NioClient<R,P>
  • Type Parameters:
    R -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpClient, JSONRPCClient

    public abstract class NioClient<R extends Request,P extends Response>
extends Object
implements Runnable
    A client to a server. The client receives server response asynchronously.
    The caller sends a request to server supplying a callback. The callback is invoked whenever server completes the request and sends a response.
    A synchronous client waits on a network channel until server responds. Hence, during that waiting period, the network channel is blocked>/em>, no other service can use it.
    An asynchronous client, such as this one, does not block the network channel. Instead, the client immediately returns (with a void) when user sends a sends a request to server.
    A client runs a i/o thread that sends requests and receives response from server. This 'main' thread is different than the thread on which user has called this client. The i/o thread runs continually until it is interrupted externally by a user.
    The '
    Author:
    pinaki poddar

    • Constructor Detail

      • NioClient

        public NioClient(String host,
                 int port,
                 boolean daemon)
          throws IOException
        Create a client supplying the address and port of the server. The client will wait for 1 second to connect to server before giving up.
        Parameters:
        host - remote host name to connect
        port - port where host listens for request
        daemon - if true runs the i/o thread as a daemon thread. If the client runs as a main program, then the i/o thread should be a non-daemon thread. Otherwise, the client will not be alive to receive an asynchronous response after the main program has exited.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • NioClient

        public NioClient(String host,
                 int port)
          throws IOException
        Create a client supplying the address and port of the server. The client will run a daemon thread for network i/o and will wait for 1 second to connect to server before giving up.
        Parameters:
        host - remote host name to connect
        port - port where host listens for request
        daemon - if true runs the i/o thread as a daemon thread. If the client runs as a main program, then the i/o thread should be a non-daemon thread. Otherwise, the client will not be alive to receive an asynchronous response after the main program has exited.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • NioClient

        public NioClient(InetAddress host,
                 int port,
                 boolean daemon,
                 int timeout,
                 TimeUnit unit)
          throws IOException
        Create a client supplying the address and port of the server.
        Note: This client starts a thread on its own. The thread will run until interrupted to listen for server response. The thread is interrupted if the server can not be connected in 2 seconds.
        Parameters:
        host - remote host address to connect
        port - port where host listens for request
        daemon - if true runs the i/o thread as a daemon thread. If the client runs as a main program, then the i/o thread should be a non-daemon thread. Otherwise, the client will not be alive to receive an asynchronous response after the main program has exited.
        timeout - time limit before client gives up attempt to connect to server.
        unit - unit of time to express the timeout value.
        Throws:
        IOException - if server can not be contacted within given timeout period.

    • Method Detail

      • getLogger

        public org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs continually until interrupted. Sends request to server and listens for response from server.
        Unlike synchronous client, this client has a lifetime that extends that of the request because it has to listen for response that arrives asynchronous to the request.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • sendRequest

        public void sendRequest(Request request,
                        ResponseCallback cb)
                 throws IOException
        Schedules given request to be sent to server. The given callback will be invoked whenever the response is received.
        This call does not block the network channel nor does it poll for a response.
        Parameters:
        request - request to be processed.
        cb - callback to be invoked when response is completed. If null, then no callback response would be invoked.
        Throws:
        IOException - i/o errors

      • readResponseFromChannel

        protected void readResponseFromChannel(SelectionKey key)
        Reads raw bytes from the channel corresponding to given key. The request object is attached with the given key. Uses the protocol to create an empty response. Then protocol-specific response reads from the channel. If the request were associated with a callback, then response will invoke callback with the data it reads from network channel.

      • getProtocol

        public Protocol<R,P> getProtocol()
        Returns the protocol.

      • getChannel

        protected final Channel getChannel()
        gets the channel that connects to the remote server.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        affirms if connected to a remote server.
